title: Lyft to Impose Surcharge to Offset Higher Gasoline Prices
sub_head: The move comes as the average price of regular gas in the U.S. reached a record high last week.
body:
More gig-driving companies are laying out plans to address surging fuel prices, with Lyft Inc. announcing a fuel surcharge and DoorDash Inc. offering a fuel rebate.
Lyft said Wednesday that riders will pay a fixed 55-cent fuel surcharge on every trip, which would go to drivers. Rival Uber Technologies Inc. said Friday that U.S. riders will pay a fuel surcharge of 45 cents to 55 cents, depending on their location. The charge for Uberâ€™s food-delivery customers ranges from 35 cents to 45 cents.
